title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Jubilant Pharmova arm to invest $300 mn in US by FY28 to double sterile injectable capacity
Jindal Stainless launches corrosion‑resistant salt trailers
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Jindal Stainless* has launched corrosion‑resistant *stainless steel* salt tipper trailers in Gujarat to reduce frequent corrosion and operational downtime.
- The trailers are about *25% lighter*, could save ₹25–30 lakh over 10 years and are expected to last *15–20 years* versus 3–4 years for conventional units.
- After pilot tests, fleet operators in Gujarat and Rajasthan are evaluating wider use; Jindal is training *ITI‑trained* fabricators and engaging logistics bodies.

items.title: JSW Steel posts record 7.9 MT crude output in Q2 FY26
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- JSW Steel reported a record consolidated *crude steel* output of **7.90 MT** in Q2 FY26, up *17% YoY* and *9% QoQ*.
- Indian operations produced **7.66 MT** with *92%* capacity utilisation; JVML commissioned a second converter and a 150‑day shutdown began to upgrade Blast Furnace 3 from 3 to 4.5 MTPA.
- Consolidated capacity is *35.7 MTPA* (34.2 MTPA domestic) with plans to raise domestic capacity to **43.4 MTPA** over three years; US unit added 0.24 MT.

items.title: Sweden to boost anti-drone defences amid growing threats
items.summary:
- Sweden will invest *3.5 billion SEK* to acquire systems to *shoot down drones*, deploy *hunter drones* for air bases and install *jamming* sensors amid rising aerial violations.
- The government will add *1.5 billion SEK* to upgrade the **JAS 39 Gripen** with spare parts, mission equipment and base materials to improve availability from air and temporary road bases.
- Officials say the measures respond to increased drone sightings and hybrid-attack concerns in Europe, highlighting NATO-member Sweden's focus on *air defence* readiness.

items.title: Gujarat emerging as India's hub for semiconductors, logistics & electronics
items.summary:
- Ashwini Vaishnaw said *Gujarat* is emerging as a foundation for India's **semiconductors**, **electronics** and *logistics*, with ~₹1.25 lakh crore invested and ₹1.15 lakh crore in scheme proposals.  
- Major projects (Tata Electronics in Dholera, Micron in Sanand), 30 Japanese suppliers and training at Ganpat University are building a full value chain from *talent development* to manufacturing.  
- Large clean‑energy projects (Khawada), ₹1.46 lakh crore rail investment, 2,764 km new lines, bullet‑train progress and faster freight corridors will boost logistics and long‑term competitiveness.

items.title: Sona Comstar & NEURA Robotics partner on humanoid tech
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Sona Comstar signed an MoU with NEURA Robotics to co-develop **advanced robotics** and humanoids for *industrialisation* in India and select markets.
- It merges Sona's manufacturing and powertrain expertise with NEURA's cognitive robotics to expand into *intelligent automation* beyond automotive.
- The tie-up aims to accelerate robotics adoption across industries, improving efficiency, scalability and new mobility/service solutions.

items.title: Andhra allots 6,000 acres to BPCL for ₹1L-cr refinery
items.summary:
- Andhra Pradesh allotted *6,000 acres* near Ramayyapatnam Port to *BPCL* for a 9–12 MMTPA greenfield refinery‑cum‑petrochemical complex (~*₹1 lakh crore*), targeting commercial operations by Jan 2029.
- State incentives include up to *75% of capex* over 20 years, 43.5% capital subsidy, full GST/SGST/IGST refunds and stamp‑duty waivers for the ultra‑mega project.
- The 600 MW project (100 MW captive) will create ~3,400 construction and ~3,750 operational jobs; the EAC has required public hearings and mitigation plans for environmental clearance.

items.title: Tata Steel says Q2 crude steel output in India rises 7%
items.summary:
- *Tata Steel India* produced *5.67 million tonnes* of crude steel in Q2FY26, up 7% YoY and 8% QoQ after normalisation post a blast furnace relining at *Jamshedpur*.
- Domestic deliveries rose to *5.56 MT*, aided by stable demand despite seasonal rains and new capacity like the Kalinganagar galvanising line and the combi mill for auto applications.
- The Tata Steel group remains a global leader with ~*35 Mtpa* capacity and a USD 26 billion FY25 turnover, highlighting ongoing portfolio upgrades.

items.title: JSW Steel hits record 7.9 MT Q2 crude steel output
items.summary:
- JSW Steel set an all-time quarterly record with consolidated *crude steel production* of **7.90 million tonnes** in Q2 FY26, up 17% YoY and 9% QoQ.
- Indian operations drove output (7.66 Mt) with *92% capacity utilisation* and Ohio added 0.24 Mt, taking H1 FY26 production to 15.16 Mt (+16% YoY).
- Expansion moves—JVML's second converter raised Indian capacity to *34.2 MTPA* and Vijayanagar's BF3 is being upgraded from 3 to *4.5 MTPA* to boost long-term supply.

items.title: India one of the most technologically inclusive societies in world: PM Modi
D2M and indigenous semiconductors signal India's deep-tech breakthrough: Tejas Networks EVP
National Critical Mineral Mission boosts India’s resilience
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- Union Minister G Kishan Reddy said the *National Critical Mineral Mission* will bolster India’s resilience in clean energy and advanced tech, enabling *Atmanirbharata* in EV batteries, solar, semiconductors and defence.
- Launched Jan 2025 with a ₹16,300 crore outlay and a ₹1,500 crore recycling incentive, the NCMM aims to cut import dependence by expanding exploration, processing and recycling of *critical minerals* (lithium, cobalt, nickel, rare earths).
- Alongside reforms like Digital India and PLI, the mission seeks private investment to secure supply chains and accelerate India’s clean‑energy transition.

items.title: Designing for the consumer: Smarter manufacturing and supply chain journeys
IG Drones to set up factory in UP Defence Corridor
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- IG Drones signed an MoU with the Government of Uttar Pradesh to build an Advanced Drone Manufacturing and R&D facility in the *UP Defence Corridor*, with state support on approvals, permissions, and incentives.
- The company plans to produce *100,000 FPV Striker drones annually*—including Kamikaze FPVs used in Operation Sindoor and frontline-trialled at the Indo-China border—aiming to boost *self-reliance* in defence technology.
- The expansion increases IG Drones' manufacturing footprint, targets employment and exports, and taps a global drone market projected to exceed **USD 55 billion by 2030** with over half the demand from military users.

items.title: Deep tech startup Haber opens AI green chemistry lab in Pune
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Haber inaugurated an *AI* *green chemistry* lab in Pune, opened by Raghunath Anant Mashelkar, to accelerate AI-driven chemistry development.
- The facility includes an integrated *pilot plant* to replicate manufacturing and rapidly prototype formulations for pulp, paper, packaging, tissue and water treatment.
- Haber will invest over *$10 million* in R&D and says its solutions have saved energy, conserved water and cut emissions to speed sustainable commercial deployment.

items.title: GlobalLogic expands Southern India presence with new Chennai facility
Vedanta Aluminium to expand all-women locomotive teams at Jharsuguda plant
Saatvik Green Energy to invest ₹3,150 crore in Odisha solar facility
Bondada Engineering commissions 78.3 MW solar projects across India
Unix makes global debut with Dubai expansion
France’s Safran to double workforce, boost sourcing from India
items.author: G Balachandar, TNN
items.summary:
- *Safran* plans to **double its workforce in India within two years** and to *double sourcing from Indian suppliers every two years*, aiming to scale MSME participation.
- It will set up an *electronics design centre* and an *electronics manufacturing facility* in Karnataka, complementing existing operations in Karnataka and Chennai to strengthen local supply chains.
- The group's India footprint (over *3,000 employees* across ~18 centres) is expanding from civil aviation to *dual-use and defence*, with projects like an *electric engine* underway.

items.title: India pivot to tech‑intensive manufacturing for exports
items.summary:
- The report urges a pivot to *high-value, technology-intensive manufacturing* supported by targeted policy incentives, capital formation, and upgraded logistics to make India's exports more resilient.
- It warns that *weak demand in advanced economies*, rising protectionism and supply‑chain fragmentation threaten trade prospects even as India targets USD 1 trillion in merchandise exports by 2030.
- Exports have already shifted toward higher-value items — engineering goods lead and *electronics* grew fivefold to USD 38.5bn, with six product groups comprising ~70% of export value.

items.title: Avaada Group signs ₹36,000 crore MoU with Gujarat
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Avaada Group signed an MoU with the Government of Gujarat at *Vibrant Gujarat 2025* to invest *₹36,000 crore* in solar, wind and battery energy storage (BESS) projects across the state.
- The projects plan to add *5 GW* of solar, *1 GW* of wind and *5 GWh* of BESS between *2027–2030* in Kutch, Banaskantha and Surendranagar.
- The move builds on Avaada’s Gujarat footprint (including a recent *280 MW* Surendranagar plant) and signals a major push for *renewable energy* capacity and storage.

items.title: Gujarat sees 22-fold jump in auto manufacturing output
items.summary:
- Gujarat's auto output rose nearly *22‑fold* from ₹3,200 Cr (2008–09) to ₹71,425 Cr (2022–23), with a post‑pandemic *109%* surge from 2020–21 to 2022–23.
- FY24‑25 exports reached ~₹13,800 Cr (₹11,172 Cr cars; ₹2,628 Cr components), shipping *177,924* vehicles to *102 countries*, expanding global reach.
- With hubs like *Sanand* and *Mandal‑Becharaji*, major OEMs and port infrastructure, Gujarat is becoming India’s **Automotive Heartland**.

items.title: Russia's industrial titans furlough workers as its war economy stalls
UK signs $468 million deal to supply India with missiles
items.summary:
- Britain signed a £350 million ($468 million) contract to supply India with UK-made *Lightweight Multirole Missiles* by **Thales**, securing about 700 jobs at a Northern Ireland factory that also supplies Ukraine.
- The deal, announced during Prime Minister *Keir Starmer*'s visit to *Narendra Modi* in Mumbai, is presented as the start of a broader *complex weapons* partnership currently under negotiation.
- The announcement coincided with a new £250 million initial phase for electric‑powered naval engines and fits Starmer's push to boost *defence exports* and meet NATO-aligned spending goals.

items.title: Crompton secures ₹52-cr solar rooftop order, targets ₹20,000-cr market
items.summary:
- Crompton Greaves Consumer Electricals has secured its first major *solar rooftop* order worth **₹52 crore** in *Telangana*.  
- The company targets a *₹20,000–₹25,000 crore* rooftop market and aims to increase its total addressable market to *₹2 lakh crore*.  
- It estimates the combined *solar pumps* and rooftops opportunity at *₹40,000–₹50,000 crore*, marking its commercial debut in large-scale rooftops.

items.title: Tata Steel says Q2 crude steel output in India rises 7%
items.summary:
- *Tata Steel India* produced **5.67 Mt** of crude steel in Q2 FY26, up *7% YoY* and *8% QoQ*.
- Deliveries rose to **5.56 Mt** (from 5.11 Mt) aided by normalization after the blast furnace relining at *Jamshedpur*.
- Capacity upgrades — a new *Kalinganagar* galvanising line with OEM approvals and a combi mill for specialty bars/wire rods — bolster auto-focused supply.

items.title: Andaman & Nicobar launches goat‑milk soap with tribes
items.summary:
- The administration launched production of *goat milk* soap in partnership with local *tribal* communities, starting at *150–200* bars/month with plans to scale by milk availability.  
- Soaps use Andaman and Teressa goat milk plus virgin coconut oil and natural essences (no water) and will be sold via government emporiums as gift hampers, touted for *moisturising*, selenium and lactic acid benefits.  
- AHVS aims to boost goat milk and cheese output, conserve germplasm and *empower tribal women* under the 'vocal for local' push.

items.title: Bhageria launches Plasticizers & Ethoxylates
items.summary:
- Bhageria Industries has begun commercial production of *Plasticizers* and *Ethoxylates* after MPCB consent, targeting PVC applications like cables, flooring, footwear and automotive components for domestic and export markets.  
- It plans to expand *H-Acid* capacity from 400 to 500 MT/month with a ₹5 crore internal investment to meet ~95% utilization, expected to add ~₹50–55 crore in annual revenue.  
- The moves aim to diversify its *specialty chemicals* portfolio and capture growth across polymer and dyes value chains.

items.title: Complex fertiliser volumes to rise 2-4% despite trade issues
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- Crisil expects *complex fertiliser* volumes to rise **2–4%** in FY26 after a 9% jump, constrained by *import availability*, geopolitical disruptions and a high base.
- *NPK* volumes are forecast up **4–6%** (supported by an adequate monsoon) while *DAP* may remain flat due to high prices despite improving availability; India imports ~*60%* of DAP.
- Manufacturers’ credit profiles should stay stable due to steady profitability and *government subsidies* including extra DAP import compensation and potential long‑term supply deals.

items.title: TSMC September Revenue +31% YoY; AI Demand Boosts Growth
items.summary:
- TSMC reported September revenue of *US$10.84B* (+**31.4% YoY**) and Jan–Sep revenue NT$2.76T (+**36.4% YoY**), driven by strong *AI* and data‑center demand.
- Revenue slipped *1.4% MoM* from August, but AI chip orders have offset weakness in smartphones and consumer electronics.
- Clients including *MediaTek*, Apple, Nvidia and AMD are adopting TSMC's **2nm** nanosheet process, boosting performance and energy efficiency.

items.title: CDSCO enforces stricter standards for pharmaceutical raw materials following fatal cough syrup incidents
Delta Electronics expands Make in India footprint to 70%
India's manufacturing sector set for strong growth and expansion: FICCI survey
L&T wins ₹15,000-cr+ NGL plant EPC order in Middle East
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- **L&T**'s Hydrocarbon Onshore arm won an *ultra-mega* EPC order (>₹15,000 crore) to build a *Natural Gas Liquids (NGL)* plant in the Middle East in consortium with **Consolidated Contractors Group**, with L&T leading engineering and procurement.
- The facility will treat *Rich Associated Gas (RAG)*—removing H₂S/CO₂/H₂O—to produce lean sales gas, ethane, propane, butane, and condensate as value-added outputs.
- The award reinforces **L&T**'s global footprint and capability to execute complex energy infrastructure, bolstering regional *energy security* and long-term hydrocarbon value chains.

items.title: Hindustan Zinc deploys 40 electric bulkers
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Hindustan Zinc has deployed 40 *electric bulkers* at its Debari zinc smelter (first 10 now) in partnership with *Enviiiro Wheels Mobility* to haul calcine to Chittorgarh under an eight‑year contract.
- The rollout replaces diesel haulage and will be phased in over months to advance cleaner logistics and support the company’s *Net Zero by 2050* goal.
- The pact also adds *electric buses* for employees to lower *Scope 3 emissions*, enhance safety, and improve operational efficiency.

items.title: AJAX Engineering rolls out personalised video outreach for dealers
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- AJAX Engineering is piloting **personalised video** outreach via *AiVANTA's IMPACT* platform, sending automated videos with the customer's name, product of interest and nearest dealer (plus Google Maps) over WhatsApp and email.
- The videos support regional languages and direct CTAs (contact dealer, book a demo, request info), enabling dealers to respond faster with better context to improve *lead-to-conversion* and dealership visits.
- AJAX and AiVANTA are exploring wider uses—AMC renewals, spare-part sales and upselling—reflecting a shift toward digital tools that enhance offline dealer ecosystems.

items.title: VECV to invest ₹544 crore in Madhya Pradesh for Volvo Group’s global AMT production hub
Qualcomm to acquire Arduino to strengthen edge computing and AI capabilities
Holtec ships 'Spent Fuel Storage Racks' to India for deployment at Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant
PEDA inks pact with IISC for green hydrogen production
India's ₹1.85L-cr NTPC green hydrogen hub, 2030 target
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- India is targeting **5 million metric tonnes** of *green hydrogen* by 2030 (about 10% global share) and expects prices to fall below $3/kg.
- NTPC's NGEL will build a **₹1.85 lakh crore** Green Hydrogen Hub at Pudimadaka with 20 GW renewables and capacity for 1,500 TPD hydrogen and 7,500 TPD derivatives.
- A pilot will launch 37 hydrogen vehicles with 9 refuelling stations, and officials say green hydrogen at $2.5/kg could replace **$150 billion** in energy imports under the National Green Hydrogen Mission.

items.title: India reaches 125 GW solar capacity, 3rd largest producer
items.summary:
- India has reached *125 GW* of solar capacity, becoming the world's **third-largest** solar energy producer, according to Union Renewable Energy Minister Pralhad Joshi.
- At the International Solar Alliance curtain-raiser he noted ISA's growth to *124 member countries*, the goal to unlock *USD 1 trillion* in solar investments by 2030, and the COP28 aim to triple global renewables to *11,000 GW* by 2030 with solar as the key.
- Domestically, programs like *Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana* have delivered rooftop solar to over *20 lakh* households, illustrating how national ambition translates into local change.

items.title: Airbus A320 flies past Boeing 737 as most-delivered jet in history
India net importer of finished steel in Sept — govt data
items.summary:
- India was a *net importer* of finished steel in September with shipments of **0.65 million tonnes**, *imports fell 36.3%* y/y while *exports rose 47.6%* to **0.58 million tonnes**.  
- Finished steel production hit **13.3 million tonnes** (up 14.7% y/y) and crude steel output was **13.8 million tonnes** (up 15% y/y), with consumption at **13.5 million tonnes** (up 9% y/y).  
- The government has proposed an *11–12% import tariff* on some steel products to curb shipments, mainly from **China**, hinting at longer-term protection measures.

items.title: ‘Tech transfer, skilling will boost chances of Chinese JVs in ECMS’
Rajnath Singh visits Australia to boost India-Australia defence partnership
Kubota to invest ₹2,000 crore in Haryana for farm equipment, tractor manufacturing after CM Saini’s Osaka talks
Helsing to buy Australian underwater drone maker
items.summary:
- German defence startup *Helsing* will acquire Australian underwater drone maker *Blue Ocean* to expand AI-powered autonomous marine systems.
- Helsing will integrate Blue Ocean's hardware and manufacturing with its AI to speed development and mass production of autonomous gliders for *underwater ISR* and maritime domain protection.
- The strategic deal, subject to court, regulatory and shareholder approvals expected in about four months, reflects rising European defence investment amid the war in Ukraine.
